member.name: IMFPMediaPlayer.ClearMediaItem

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Clears the current media item.
summary.div: Note This method is currently not implemented.

member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IMFPMediaPlayer.CreateMediaItemFromObject

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Creates a media item from an object.

member.param: A pointer to the object's IUnknown interface. See Remarks.
If TRUE, the method blocks until it completes. If FALSE, the method does not block and completes asynchronously.
Application-defined value to store in the media item. To retrieve this value from the media item, call .
Receives a pointer to the interface. The caller must release the interface. If fSync is TRUE, this parameter must be a valid pointer. If bSync is FALSE, this parameter must be NULL.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: Invalid request. This error can occur when fSync is FALSE and the application did not provide a callback interface. See Remarks.

member.name: IMFPMediaPlayer.CreateMediaItemFromURL

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Creates a media item from a URL.

member.param: Null-terminated string that contains the URL of a media file.
If TRUE, the method blocks until it completes. If FALSE, the method does not block and completes asynchronously.
Application-defined value to store in the media item. To retrieve this value from the media item, call .
Receives a pointer to the interface. The caller must release the interface. If fSync is TRUE, this parameter must be a valid pointer. If bSync is FALSE, this parameter must be NULL.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: Invalid request. This error can occur when fSync is FALSE and the application did not provide a callback interface. See Remarks.

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Steps forward one video frame.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description:
Cannot frame step. Reasons for this error code include:
There is no media item queued for playback.
The current media item does not contain video.
The media source does not support frame stepping, or the current playback rate is negative.

member.name: IMFPMediaPlayer.GetAspectRatioMode

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Gets the current aspect-ratio correction mode. This mode controls whether the aspect ratio of the video is preserved during playback.

member.param: Receives a bitwise OR of one or more flags from the enumeration.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The current media item does not contain video.

member.name: IMFPMediaPlayer.GetBalance

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Gets the current audio balance.

param.name: pflBalance
param.para: Receives the balance. The value can be any number in the following range (inclusive).

listheader.description: The left channel is at full volume; the right channel is silent.
The right channel is at full volume; the left channel is silent.

param.para: If the value is zero, the left and right channels are at equal volumes. The default value is zero.

member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IMFPMediaPlayer.GetBorderColor

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Gets the current color of the video border. The border color is used to letterbox the video.

member.param: Receives the border color as a COLORREF value.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The current media item does not contain video.

member.name: IMFPMediaPlayer.GetDuration

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Gets the playback duration of the current media item.

param.name: guidPositionType
param.para: Specifies the unit of time for the duration. The following value is defined.

listheader.description:
100-nanosecond units.
The value returned in pvDurationValue is a ULARGE_INTEGER.
Variant type (vt): VT_UI8
Variant member: uhVal

member.param: Pointer to a PROPVARIANT that receives the duration.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: The media source does not have a duration. This error can occur with a live source, such as a video camera.
There is no current media item.

member.name: IMFPMediaPlayer.GetIdealVideoSize

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Gets the range of video sizes that can be displayed without significantly degrading performance or image quality.

member.param: Receives the minimum size that is preferable. This parameter can be NULL.
Receives the maximum size that is preferable. This parameter can be NULL.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The current media item does not contain video.

member.name: IMFPMediaPlayer.GetMediaItem

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Gets a pointer to the current media item.

member.param: Receives a pointer to the media item's interface. The caller must release the interface.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: There is no current media item.
There is no current media item.

member.name: IMFPMediaPlayer.GetMute

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Queries whether the audio is muted.

member.param: Receives the value TRUE if the audio is muted, or FALSE otherwise.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IMFPMediaPlayer.GetNativeVideoSize

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Gets the size and aspect ratio of the video. These values are computed before any scaling is done to fit the video into the destination window.

member.param: Receives the size of the video, in pixels. This parameter can be NULL.
Receives the picture aspect ratio of the video. This parameter can be NULL.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The current media item does not contain video.

member.name: IMFPMediaPlayer.GetPosition

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Gets the current playback position.

param.name: guidPositionType
param.para: Specifies the unit of time for the playback position. The following value is defined.

listheader.description:
100-nanosecond units.
The value returned in pvPositionValue is a LARGE_INTEGER.
Variant type (vt): VT_I8
Variant member: hVal

member.param: Pointer to a PROPVARIANT that receives the playback position.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: No media item has been queued.

member.name: IMFPMediaPlayer.GetRate

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Gets the current playback rate.

member.param: Receives the playback rate. The playback rate is expressed as a ratio of the current rate to the normal rate. For example, 1.0 indicates normal playback, 0.5 indicates half speed, and 2.0 indicates twice speed. Positive values indicate forward playback, and negative values indicate reverse playback.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IMFPMediaPlayer.GetState

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Gets the current playback state of the MFPlay player object.

member.param: Receives the playback state, as a member of the enumeration.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IMFPMediaPlayer.GetSupportedRates

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Gets the range of supported playback rates.

member.param: Specify TRUE to get the playback rates for forward playback. Specify FALSE to get the rates for reverse playback.
Receives the slowest supported rate.
Receives the fastest supported rate.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: The current media item does not support playback in the requested direction (either forward or reverse).

member.name: IMFPMediaPlayer.GetVideoSourceRect

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Gets the video source rectangle.

member.param:
Pointer to an structure that specifies the source rectangle. This rectangle defines which portion of the video is displayed. It is specified in normalized coordinates, which are defined as follows:
The upper-left corner of the video image is (0, 0).
The lower-right corner of the video image is (1, 1).
If the source rectangle is {0, 0, 1, 1}, the entire image is displayed. This is the default value.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The current media item does not contain video.

member.name: IMFPMediaPlayer.GetVideoWindow

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Gets the window where the video is displayed.

member.param: Receives a handle to the application window where the video is displayed.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IMFPMediaPlayer.GetVolume

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Gets the current audio volume.

member.param: Receives the audio volume. Volume is expressed as an attenuation level, where 0.0 indicates silence and 1.0 indicates full volume (no attenuation).
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Applies an audio or video effect to playback.

param.name: pEffect
param.para: Pointer to the IUnknown interface for one of the following:

item.description: A Media Foundation transform (MFT) that implements the effect. MFTs expose the interface.
An activation object that creates an MFT. Activation objects expose the interface.

param.name: fOptional
param.para: Specifies whether the effect is optional.

listheader.description: The effect is optional. If the MFPlay player object cannot add the effect, it ignores the effect and continues playback.
If the MFPlay player object cannot add the effect, a playback error occurs.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Pauses playback. While playback is paused, the most recent video frame is displayed, and audio is silent.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Starts playback.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Removes all effects that were added with the method.

member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IMFPMediaPlayer.RemoveEffect

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Removes an effect that was added with the method.

member.param: Pointer to the IUnknown interface of the effect object. Use the same pointer that you passed to the method.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

member.param: Bitwise OR of one or more flags from the enumeration.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Sets the audio balance.

param.name: flBalance
param.para: The audio balance. The value can be any number in the following range (inclusive).

listheader.description: The left channel is at full volume; the right channel is silent.
The right channel is at full volume; the left channel is silent.

member.name: IMFPMediaPlayer.SetBorderColor

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Sets the color for the video border. The border color is used to letterbox the video.

member.param: Specifies the border color as a COLORREF value. Use the RGB macro to create this value. The default value is black.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The current media item does not contain video.

member.name: IMFPMediaPlayer.SetMediaItem

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Queues a media item for playback.

member.param: Pointer to the interface of the media item.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The media item contains protected content. MFPlay currently does not support protected content.
No audio playback device was found. This error can occur if the media source contains audio, but no audio playback devices are available on the system.

member.name: IMFPMediaPlayer.SetMute

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Mutes or unmutes the audio.

member.param: Specify TRUE to mute the audio, or FALSE to unmute the audio.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IMFPMediaPlayer.SetPosition

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Sets the playback position.

param.name: guidPositionType
param.para: Unit of time for the playback position. The following value is defined.

listheader.description:
100-nanosecond units.
The value of pvPositionValue must be a LARGE_INTEGER.
Variant type (vt): VT_I8
Variant member: hVal

member.param: New playback position. The meaning and data type of this parameter are indicated by the guidPositionType parameter.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The value of pvPositionValue is not valid.
No media item has been queued.

member.name: IMFPMediaPlayer.SetRate

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Sets the playback rate.

member.param: Playback rate. The playback rate is expressed as a ratio of the current rate to the normal rate. For example, 1.0 indicates normal playback speed, 0.5 indicates half speed, and 2.0 indicates twice speed. Positive values indicate forward playback, and negative values indicate reverse playback.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

member.name: IMFPMediaPlayer.SetVideoSourceRect

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Sets the video source rectangle.
MFPlay clips the video to this rectangle and stretches the rectangle to fill the video window.

member.param:
Pointer to an structure that specifies the source rectangle. This rectangle defines which portion of the video is displayed. It is specified in normalized coordinates, which are defined as follows:
The upper-left corner of the video image is (0, 0).
The lower-right corner of the video image is (1, 1).
To display the entire image, set the source rectangle to {0, 0, 1, 1}. This is the default value.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The current media item does not contain video.

member.name: IMFPMediaPlayer.SetVolume

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Sets the audio volume.

member.param: The volume level. Volume is expressed as an attenuation level, where 0.0 indicates silence and 1.0 indicates full volume (no attenuation).

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

member.name: IMFPMediaPlayer.Shutdown

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Shuts down the MFPlay player object and releases any resources the object is using.

member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Stops playback.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Updates the video frame.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The current media item does not contain video.

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Contains methods to play media files.
The MFPlay player object exposes this interface. To get a pointer to this interface, call .
